metadata.Title: CVE-2018-20153 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
In WordPress before 4.9.9 and 5.x before 5.0.1, contributors could modifynew comments made by users with greater privileges, possibly causing XSS.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-20153` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

wordpress - 5.0.1+dfsg1-1
wordpress-l10n - 5.0.1+dfsg1-1
wordpress-theme-twentynineteen - 5.0.1+dfsg1-1
wordpress-theme-twentytwenty - 5.0.1+dfsg1-1
wordpress-theme-twentytwentyone - 5.0.1+dfsg1-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: wordpress package in esm-apps/jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.0.1+dfsg1-1').
